text:
REPORT: Trump Draft Executive Order on Welfare Has Liberals FURIOUS 
Far from being innocent victims, the bulk of the criminal illegals detained during the raids were “convicted of crimes including, but not limited to, homicide, aggravated sexual abuse, sexual assault of a minor, lewd and lascivious acts with a child, indecent liberties with a minor, drug trafficking, battery, assault, DUI and weapons charges.” 
“These operations targeted public safety threats, such as convicted criminal aliens and gang members, as well as individuals who have violated our nation’s immigration laws, including those who illegally re-entered the country after being removed and immigration fugitives ordered removed by federal immigration judges,” the statement added. The raids reportedly occurred in 11 states across the country, but were especially noticeable in such cities as Atlanta, Chicago, Los Angeles, New York City and San Antonio, Texas. Advertisement - story continues below “We’re actually taking people that are criminals, very, very hardened criminals in some cases, with a tremendous track record of abuse and problems,” Trump explained during a news conference Monday. “And we are getting them out. And that’s what I said I would do. I’m just doing what I said I would do when we won by a very, very large Electoral College vote.” More actual information about the raids, not rumor or innuendo, can be found at this convenient “ Fact Sheet ” released publicly by DHS. The release made clear that similarly targeted raids had occurred from time to time during the Obama administration. As for the overblown and blatantly false reports about the raids from the biased media and illegal immigration advocacy groups, a spokeswoman for DHS and the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency attempted to calm everybody down with some straight facts that have been ignored or misreported, according to Yahoo News . “ICE is not performing indiscriminate raids or sweeps or checkpoints when we go out. We know the people we want to apprehend,” explained DHS Press Secretary Gillian Christensen. “We’re not just going to random doors or pulling random cars over.” Advertisement - story continues below
